title: Can Art make a question too complicated to answer? - Quora

response.answer_text: The object of Art is not to ask questions or even to answer them but to get the observer to think and feel. Real Art should invoke a feeling about the subject of the art and draw an opinion about the subject matter. In a portrait you should draw an opinion of what type of person is in the portrait you should get a feeling for what type of person is portrayed, this feeling can be accurate or false but is not an answer just a feeling. In a landscape you should get a feeling for the location either good or bad not an answer to any question about the location just a feeling for the location you are looking at. All art is the effort of the artist to feel or see something from his/her perspective and feel what he/she feels or sees. Art does not ask or answer questions but may make you face questions you have abut something and then try to have you answer your question.
